    • Method Detail

      • isRolloverSupported

        public boolean isRolloverSupported()
        Description copied from interface: MaintenanceManager
        Checks if this database supports the rollover mechanism.

        A rollover refers to the process of extracting the head version of the current database state, and copying it into a new container, called a chunk (see also: ChronoChunk). This limits the amount of historical data per chunk, allowing for faster queries in each individual chunk. However, as each rollover duplicates the head revision, it also increases the memory footprint of the database on disk.

        Specified by:
        isRolloverSupported in interface MaintenanceManager
        Returns:
        true if this database supports the rollover operation, otherwise false.

      • performRolloverOnBranch

        public void performRolloverOnBranch(java.lang.String branchName)
        Description copied from interface: MaintenanceManager
        Performs a rollover on the branch with the given name.

        Not all backends support this operation. Please use MaintenanceManager.isRolloverSupported() first to check if this operation is supported or not.

        Specified by:
        performRolloverOnBranch in interface MaintenanceManager
        Parameters:
        branchName - The branch name to roll over. Must not be null, must refer to an existing branch.

      • performRolloverOnAllBranches

        public void performRolloverOnAllBranches()
        Description copied from interface: MaintenanceManager
        Performs a rollover on all existing branches.

        Not all backends support this operation. Please use MaintenanceManager.isRolloverSupported() first to check if this operation is supported or not.

        Important note: This method is not guaranteed to be ACID safe. Rollovers will be executed one after the other. If an unexpected event (such as JVM crash, exceptions, power supply failure...) occurs, then some branches may have been rolled over while others have not.

        This is a very expensive operation that can substantially increase the memory footprint of the database on disk. Use with care.

        Specified by:
        performRolloverOnAllBranches in interface MaintenanceManager

      • performRolloverOnAllBranchesWhere

        public void performRolloverOnAllBranchesWhere(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.String> branchPredicate)
        Description copied from interface: MaintenanceManager
        Performs a rollover on all branches that match the given predicate.

        Not all backends support this operation. Please use MaintenanceManager.isRolloverSupported() first to check if this operation is supported or not.

        Important note: This method is not guaranteed to be ACID safe. Rollovers will be executed one after the other. If an unexpected event (such as JVM crash, exceptions, power supply failure...) occurs, then some branches may have been rolled over while others have not.

        This is a potentially very expensive operation that can substantially increase the memory footprint of the database on disk. Use with care.

        Specified by:
        performRolloverOnAllBranchesWhere in interface MaintenanceManager
        Parameters:
        branchPredicate - The predicate that decides whether or not to roll over the branch in question. Must not be null.
